plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: The Madonna Lily is a fragrant, tall perennial with large, trumpet-shaped white flowers. It is often found in Mediterranean climates and has been cultivated since ancient times for its beauty and scent.
plants.location: Mediterranean region, Southern Europe, North Africa
plants.funFact: Madonna Lilies have been symbols of purity and have appeared in religious art and literature for centuries.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its large, tulip-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The flowers appear before the leaves and can range from white to pink and purple hues.
plants.location: Native to China, widely cultivated in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolia is a hybrid species and one of the earliest magnolias to bloom in spring, often signaling the start of the season.

plants.name: Rhododendron macrophyllum
plants.description: A species of rhododendron shrub native to the western coastal regions of North America. It produces clusters of bright pink to purple flowers in spring.
plants.funFact: The Pacific Rhododendron is the state flower of Washington state and thrives in moist, acidic soils.

plants.name: Wisteria sinensis
plants.description: A woody, deciduous vine with cascading racemes of highly fragrant lavender-blue flowers. It blooms in spring, often covering entire trees or structures with blossoms.
plants.location: Native to China, cultivated worldwide in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Chinese Wisteria can live for over 100 years and is known for its vigorous growth and spectacular floral displays.
